alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 11:49AM CST until March 08 at 4:40PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Meramec River near Eureka. Meramec River at Pacific. Meramec River at Valley Park. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River at Pacific. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.6 feet, Horneker Road begins to flood near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 1.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday morning to a crest of 18.8 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Meramec River Pacific 15.0 1.7 8.2 14.9 18.8 16.4 8.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
